text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Jane: What time is it, Tom?
Sam: Just a minute. It's ten to nine by my watch.
Jane: Is it? I had no idea it was so late. I must be off now.
Sam: What's the hurry?
Jane: I must catch the nine-thirty train.
Sam: You've plenty of time yet. The railway station is very close. It won't take more than twenty minutes to get there.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
text.Response A: The conversation takes place between Jane and Sam, and it starts with Jane asking about the time. Sam uses his watch to check the time and finds that it is about ten minutes to nine, and he replies to Jane. Jane is surprised to know that it is so late and says that she must leave now. Sam tries to convince her that she has plenty of time to catch the train as the railway station is close, and it will take only twenty minutes to reach there.
text.Response B: Jane needs to catch the 9:30 train. The railway station is close and it won't take more than 20 minutes to get there.
